Sentencas: A hybrid solid oxide fuel cell and gas turbine (SOFC/GT) system exploits the complementary features of the two power plants, where the GT recuperates the energy in the SOFC exhaust stream and thereby boosting the overall system efficiency.
Titulo: Incremental Step Reference Governor for Load Conditioning of Hybrid Fuel Cell and Gas Turbine Power Plants

Sentencas: Through model based transient analysis, however, it is shown that the intricate coupling dynamics make the transient load following very challenging.
Titulo: Incremental Step Reference Governor for Load Conditioning of Hybrid Fuel Cell and Gas Turbine Power Plants

Sentencas: Power shutdown has been observed when the load is changed abruptly in the generator.
Titulo: Incremental Step Reference Governor for Load Conditioning of Hybrid Fuel Cell and Gas Turbine Power Plants

Sentencas: In this work, a novel closed-loop reference governor controller is proposed to mitigate the shutdown phenomenon.
Titulo: Incremental Step Reference Governor for Load Conditioning of Hybrid Fuel Cell and Gas Turbine Power Plants

Sentencas: The reference governor utilizes the region of attraction of a reduced order SOFC/GT model to determine if an incremental step change is allowable, i.e., it does not cause a shutdown.
Titulo: Incremental Step Reference Governor for Load Conditioning of Hybrid Fuel Cell and Gas Turbine Power Plants

Sentencas: It is shown that with a moderate computational cost, the speed of the hybrid power system response can be improved significantly compared to the fastest conventional load filter.
Titulo: Incremental Step Reference Governor for Load Conditioning of Hybrid Fuel Cell and Gas Turbine Power Plants

Sentencas: Several design parameters, such as the sampling rate and incremental step-size, are also explored to understand the trade-offs between computational complexity and performance improvement.
Titulo: Incremental Step Reference Governor for Load Conditioning of Hybrid Fuel Cell and Gas Turbine Power Plants
